page.title: 08Horeb Baptist Chapel,5 Rds
page.content: Those attending the chapel have dropped from 39 in 1974 to 23 presently.Half of those are regular to the afternoon service in Welsh.5 deacons choose who will preach each week as there is no minister.The most important service being Easter Service when all attend.Present secretary Mr.M.Davies preaches occasionally and was the last to be baptised.Baptism is in the Lliedi river and is performed by a minister.In 1982 a ceremony to celebrate 150yrs of the chapel took place and was attended by many other chapels from Llanelli.In 1983,1200 pounds was raised to repair the facade and part of the roof.There is another chapel in the area with a similar congregation.Once a month a church service is held in the school hall. There are indications that church attendance in the area is in decline.
